org.bbi.linuxjoy

Class SocketJoystick

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bbi.linuxjoy.LinuxJoystick
      • org.bbi.linuxjoy.SocketJoystick

  • public class SocketJoystick
extends LinuxJoystick
    This joystick implementation reads off a socket instead of a file. The "path" variable is the internet socket address (host:port) if acting as a client, or just the port if we are acting as a server

    • Method Detail

      • channelOpen

        protected boolean channelOpen()
        Description copied from class: LinuxJoystick
        The channel open routine. By default, the channel is implemented as a FileChannel. Override this function if other data input type is needed.
        Overrides:
        channelOpen in class LinuxJoystick
        Returns:
        True if open is successful, false otherwise

      • channelRead

        protected int channelRead()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: LinuxJoystick
        The channel read routine. This defaults to reading from a file. This function can be overridden if other channel types are desired.
        Overrides:
        channelRead in class LinuxJoystick
        Returns:
        Number of bytes read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - I/O exception is thrown from this function
